intro: Hieracium laxisquamum, commonly known as the broad-leafed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium laxisquamum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
